===Overview===
The '''Ancient Greeks''' or "Hellenes" and their land was "Hellas". The name "Greeks" was given to the people of Greece later by the [[Roman Empire]]. They lived in mainland [[Greece]] and the Greek islands, but also in colonies scattered around the [[Mediterranean Sea]]. There were Greeks in [[Italy]], [[Sicily]], [[Turkey]], North [[Africa]]. They sailed the sea to trade and find new lands. The Greeks took their ideas with them and they started a way of life that's similar to the one we have today.

===Olympians===
{{MessageBox
| Message = For the full presentation of their activities, please consult the '''[[Olympian History]]''' page.
}}
The Ancient Greeks worshiped as gods powerful extradimensional humanoid beings known as the [[Olympians]]. They lived in [[Olympus (City)|Olympus]], a small [[Olympus (Realm)|"pocket dimension"]] adjacent to Earth; an interdimensional nexus between Olympus and Earth exists somewhere on [[Mount Olympus]] in Greece. These beings helped the formed the Greek civilization.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe #8}}

The Greeks believed when they died they went to [[Realm of the Dead]], [[Hades (Underworld)|Hades, the Underworld]]. it was ruled by the Olympian [[Hades (Earth-616)|Hades]] They then pass the guardian [[Cerberus (Earth-616)|Cerberus]] the three headed dog. The arriving spirits pass through the dismal [[Asphodel Fields]] to a section called [[Erebus (Hades)|Erebus]] where their soul was judged. The are then ferried down the [[River Styx (Hades)|River Styx]] by [[Charon (Olympian) (Earth-616)|Charon]] to either [[Tartarus (Hades)|Tartarus]] for punishment or [[Elysium (Hades)|Elysium]] Greek Heaven.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe Vol 2 8}}

===[[Eternals (Homo immortalis)|Eternals]]===
{{MessageBox
| Message = For the full presentation of their activities, please consult the '''[[Eternal History]]''' page.
}}
The [[Eternals (Homo immortalis)|Eternals]] a genetic splinter group of humanity settled in the city of [[Olympia]] which was located in the fountains of Greece. One of the most active as the time was the exiled [[Gilgamesh (Earth-616)|Forgotten One]].{{r|Captain America Annual #11}} The Eternals were often mistaken for the Olympians. However, a non-interference pact was forged between Olympian ruler [[Zeus Panhellenios (Earth-616)|Zeus]] and Prime Eternal Zuras. As a show of good faith for their new found unity, Zuras' daughter [[Thena (Earth-616)|Azura]] re-christened herself Thena, after [[Athena Parthenos (Earth-616)|Athena]], daughter of Zeus.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe #11}}
